title: Shahin Imranov
text:
Shahin Imranov () (born 23 September 1980) is a <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> from <a href="Azerbaijan">Azerbaijan</a>. He is
best known for winning two featherweight silver medals at European championships.
Career.
Imranov won a silver medal at the <a href="2002%20European%20Amateur%20Boxing%20Championships">2002 European Amateur Boxing Championships</a>. He qualified for the <a href="2004%20Summer%20Olympics">2004 Summer Olympics</a> by ending up in second place at the <a href="2nd%20AIBA%20European%202004%20Olympic%20Qualifying%20Tournament">2nd AIBA European 2004 Olympic Qualifying Tournament</a> in Warsaw, Poland. In <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics">the 2004 Olympics boxing tournament</a> he was defeated in the second round of the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Featherweight">featherweight (57 kg)</a> division by the eventual gold medal winner, Russian <a href="Alexei%20Tichtchenko">Alexei Tichtchenko</a>.
He repeated his 2002 championship success at the <a href="2006%20European%20Amateur%20Boxing%20Championships">2006 European Amateur Boxing Championships</a>. At the world championships of 2007 he was upset by Indian <a href="Anthresh%20Lalit%20Lakra">Anthresh Lalit Lakra</a>. At the 2008 Olympics he retired with an elbow injury in his semifinal against <a href="Khedafi%20Djelkhir">Khedafi Djelkhir</a> and won Bronze, he was trailing 2–5.
